JobFullDesc: Facebook is looking for an analytical thinker who brings a global perspective and passion for impact to join our Product Policy team. Our team provides strategic guidance and principled frameworks for how our products can best serve the people on Facebook and its family of services. In particular, in this role you will be a part of our company-wide integrity efforts, with a focus on how our systems serve people in places around the world facing heightened risks of conflict or repression of rights. As a Product Policy Associate Manager, you will work closely with a wide range of colleagues across Facebook and Instagram, including product managers, crisis response teams, researchers, communications and marketing teams, and operations teams. You’ll be responsible for applying complex, evolving frameworks to innovative products and initiatives, and building the principles that underpin scalable guidance for product teams. You’ll use your judgment to evaluate product launches, spot risks, give strategic guidance, and make difficult decisions, including under time pressure. Most importantly, the ideal candidate will be able to work collaboratively with the product teams to not merely identify potential problems, but also to help solve those problems and improve our products.  Additionally, you will play a key role managing policy development processes, including developing and refining the policies and principles that govern algorithmic ranking and content distribution on Facebook and its family of applications. This work will include identifying policy gaps, considering data, collaborating with product teams, seeking feedback internally and externally, and building consensus for proposed solutions.  Successful candidates will have experience communicating effectively with a variety of audiences, and be creative problem-solvers who can work both independently and collaboratively. You’ll be able to critically analyze and communicate the costs and benefits of product policies and their implementation, and successfully execute both detailed work and high-level strategic thinking. Ideal candidates will also have experience in global policy or strategy development, whether private, nonprofit or government, as well as in cross-functional work and consensus building.
